metadata.title: X Algorithm Weighted Scoring System
metadata.description: Comprehensive guide to how X assigns weighted scores to posts in the For You timeline, including metric weights, penalties, and optimization strategies.
metadata.author: Jetro Olowole

sections.content: The X algorithm assigns numerical weights to every user action (replies, likes, retweets, reports) to calculate a final score for each post. Posts with higher scores appear in more For You timelines. This guide breaks down the exact weights used by Phoenix scorer, explains penalty systems, and provides actionable optimization strategies.
Key Takeaway: Reply engagement by the original author carries the highest weight (75), while negative reports apply the harshest penalty (-369). Optimize for author replies to maximize visibility.

The Phoenix scorer evaluates posts using a multi-stage pipeline. After retrieval (candidate selection), each post receives a weighted score based on predicted engagement probabilities. Here are the primary metrics and their weights:

When the original post author replies to your reply, X interprets this as a strong signal of quality conversation. This 75-weight multiplier is the highest in the systemâ€”5x higher than a regular reply (13.5) and 7.5x higher than a like (10).

items: Ask genuine questions that invite author responses
Reply early in the post lifecycle when authors are most active
Avoid generic comments like 'Great post!' or emoji-only replies

sections.content: Negative actions dramatically reduce post scores. A single report penalty (-369) can offset 37 likes (10 each) or nearly 5 retweets (20 each). Here's how to avoid penalties:

items: Avoid controversial takes in high-risk niches (politics, crypto scams)
Monitor report rate via Twitter Analytics or third-party tools
If flagged, appeal immediately through X's support system

sections.question: What is the report rate threshold for filtering?
sections.answer: While X doesn't publish exact thresholds, internal signals suggest a report rate above 2% (2 reports per 100 impressions) triggers pre-scoring filters. Posts with 5%+ report rates are often shadow-banned from For You timelines entirely.

sections.content: Based on the weighted scoring system, here are proven tactics to boost your final score:
Target accounts with high reply rates (journalists, customer service accounts, active community builders). Use tools like NotifyMe for Chrome to get instant notifications when target accounts post.

High-engagement posts attract both positive signals (retweets, likes) and negative ones (reports from opposing viewpoints). Monitor your virality index (viral impressions / total impressions) and report rate in tandem.
Pro Tip: A virality index above 40% with report rate below 1% is the sweet spot for sustained growth without penalties.
